column4: might you point me to a guide that would allow a ubuntu user to host their own "godaddy" webserver on their ubuntu desktop ?
so you have a domain from godaddy and you'd like to host a webserver for that domain on your home PC?
yes basically that is something i'd be open to doing
do you have a static or dynamic address at home?
a guide would be great i realize you probably could not explain all the steps here
it is static, though it has a lease time for renewal
and on renewal, do you get the same address?
no however that doesn't happen too often
i realize you can't help me here, but if you know of a guide to do what i hope to accomplish, that'd be spiffy
setting up apache is quite easy, the hard part is using some sort of dynamic dns service (dyndns, zoneedit, etc) to map domain name to IP address and vice versa.
might you know of a free dns service that would be sufficient for personal web server application
and godaddy, unless you know if a better domain registrant
the domain registrar can be anything. I would use zonedit as the DNS service unless I setup a DNS server at home - but a static IP address is required.
you would not setup a apache web server from home ?
If i setup a webserver at home, it would serve a low load. Plus it's against my ISP's ToS to do so. I'd rather pay for a VPS and be guaranteed good bandwidth and availability.
